info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 21 at 11:31AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall over vulnerable wildfire burn scars is possible. * WHERE...A portion of north central New Mexico, including the following area, East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHEN...Until 10 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall may lead to excessive runoff over recent wildfire burn scars such as the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon and Cooks Peak scars. This excessive runoff may result in flash flooding and possible debris flows through creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Slow-moving thunderstorms producing high rainfall rates over wildfire burn scars will potentially lead to localized flash flooding. - https://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
